                    CHEMICALS

mdma



Spiral Erowid Zip Hoodie

This black mid-weight zip hoodie (80/20) has front pockets, an Erowid logo on front chest, and a spiral design on back.

Donate and receive yours!

NAME : MDMA CHEMICAL NAME : 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine ALTERNATE CHEMICAL NAMES : 3,4-methylenedioxy-n-methylamphetamine; N, alpha-Dimethyl-1,3-benzodioxole-5-ethanamine; methylenedioxy-n-methylamphetamine; N-methyl-3,4-methylenedioxyphenylisopropylamine; Ecstasy; E; XTC; Adam CHEMICAL FORMULA C 11 H 15 NO 2 MOLECULAR WEIGHT 193.25 MELTING POINT 147-148Â° C (Hydrochloride crystals from isopropanol/n-hexane) MELTING POINT 152-153Â° C (Hydrochloride crystals from isopropanol/ether) LD 50 (mice) 97 mg/kg i.p. LD 50 (rats) 49 mg/kg i.p. LD 50 (guinea pigs) 98 mg/kg i.p. From the Merck Index 12th Edition

MDMA Molecule

MDMA Material Safety Data Sheet (Radian)

                    Context: 
                    This section from the Erowid MDMA information page provides key chemical data, alternative names, molecular formula, physical properties, and toxicity values for MDMA (Ecstasy), alongside links to resources such as safety data sheets and synthesis information. It is part of a comprehensive chemicals index within Erowid's larger psychoactive substances database.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Chemistry
metadata.description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    5806. MDMA. N, alpha-Dimethyl-1,3-benzodioxole-5-ethanamine; 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine; N-methyl-3,4-methylenedioxyphenylisopropylamine; "Ecstasy"; "E"; "XTC"; "Adam". CHNO; mol wt 193.25. C 68.37%, H 7.82%, N 7.25%, O 16.56%. Entactogen; N-methyl derivative of MDA, q.v. (S)-Form possesses more potent CNS activity. Prepn: Ger. pat. 274,350 (1914 to E. Merck), C.A. 8, 3350 (1914); U. Braun et al., J. Pharm.Sci. 69, 192 (1980). Spectral and chromatographic analyses: K. Bailey et al., J. Assoc. Offic. Anal. Chem. 58, 62 (1975). GC/MS determn in urine: B.K. Gan et al., J. Forensic Sci. 36, 1331 (1991). HPLC determn in whole blood: R. E. Michel et al., J. Neurosci. Methods 50, 61 (1993). Acute toxicity study: H. F. Hardman et al., Toxicol. Appl. Pharmacol. 25, 199 (1973). Series of articles on history, pharmacology, and neurotoxicity: : Ann. N.Y. Acad. Sci. 600, 601-715 (1990). Review of biochemical actions: M. Rattray, Essays Biochem. 26, 77-87 (1991); of pharmacology, toxicology,


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from the MDMA chemical information section, providing detailed scientific data on MDMA's chemical names, molecular properties, synthesis history, potency, and references to analytical, pharmacological, and toxicological studies. It appears after general chemical identifiers and safety details, as part of Erowid's comprehensive profile on MDMA.

Rattray, Essays Biochem. 26, 77-87 (1991); of pharmacology, toxicology, and human experience: T.D. Steele et al., Addictions 89, 539-551 (1994); A.R. Green et al., Psychopharmacology 119, 247-260 (1995).

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information and images about the chemistry of MDMA.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Chemistry

                    Text: 
                    2D MDMA MOLECULE

Oil, bp 100-110degrees Hydrocholoride, CHNO.HCl, crystals from isopopanol/n-hexane, mp 147-148Â° (Bailey). Crystals from isopropanol/ether, mp 152-153Â° (Braun). uv max (ethanol): 286 nm (E 2843). LD in mice, rats, guinea pigs (mg/gk): 97,49,98 i.p. (Hardman). Note: This is a controlled substance (hallucinogen) listed in the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations, Title 21 Part 1308.11 (1995).
